title: Module 4 Assessment
description: Test your understanding of AI Act governance and penalties.

questions.question: What is the maximum penalty for prohibited AI practices?
questions.explanation: Article 99 establishes that violations of Article 5 prohibited practices carry the highest penalty tier: up to €35 million or 7% of total worldwide annual turnover.

questions.question: Which body coordinates GPAI model enforcement at EU level?
questions.explanation: The AI Office, established within the Commission, coordinates enforcement of GPAI model provisions at the EU level.

questions.question: What must each Member State designate?
questions.explanation: Each Member State must designate or establish at least one national competent authority and a market surveillance authority.

questions.question: Which factor may REDUCE penalties?
questions.explanation: Prompt corrective action is a mitigating factor that may reduce penalties. Cooperation, first infringement, and good faith efforts also reduce penalties.

questions.question: What triggers market surveillance activity?
questions.explanation: Market surveillance may be triggered by random sampling, complaints, incidents, information from other authorities, media reports, or post-market monitoring data.

questions.question: What must providers report regarding serious incidents?
questions.explanation: Providers must report serious incidents to relevant market surveillance authorities within appropriate timeframes.

questions.question: How does the AI Act treat SME penalties?
questions.explanation: For SMEs and startups, the lower of the two penalty caps (€ amount vs turnover percentage) applies, with proportionality considerations.

questions.question: What is the role of the AI Board?
questions.explanation: The AI Board is an advisory body of national authority representatives that advises the Commission and contributes to consistent application across Member States.
